page.title: 16THE MAYOR SPEAKS (1)
page.content:
With ancient roots dating back to 1204, the Town Council is a repository of tradition in an era of rapid social change. In spite of the curtailment of the powers of Town Councils since the Act of 1974, we take pride in our regalia and in those who carry them.
At the Mayor-Making on May 13th., 1985, I suggested that the theme of the year should be that of looking outwards, little guessing that within days the town would be the centre of interest of the media. A "hippy" convoy of some 100 vehicles sought refuge in the Savernake Forest after a confrontation with the police near Stonehenge. I went to the site, trying to be as inconspicous as possible in dirty old jeans and a sweat shirt, but I felt myself overdressed in that company.
